projects: [{"title":"Distributed Online Store","start_date":"Jan 2021","end_date":"Apr 2021","description":"â€¢ Developed an Online store with decentralized database, following Sequential Consistency and active replication.â€¢ Implemented atomic multicast to achieve Sequential Consistency, where requests are sent to database server in round robin fashion.â€¢ Hosted 7 nodes (5 backend database server and 2 web server) on multiple AWS ec2 instances to achieve fault-tolerance in demo."},{"title":"Networks","start_date":"Jan 2020","end_date":"Apr 2020","description":"â€¢ Implemented a server where multiple clients can request for same or different services and the server serves them concurrently.â€¢ Implemented a simple proxy server over TCP and a simple HTTP Proxy Server.â€¢ Built support for reliable communication over an unreliable link where the unreliable link is implemented with a UDP socket."},{"title":"Operating Systems","start_date":"Jan 2020","end_date":"Apr 2020","description":"â€¢ Implemented a rudimentary shell running on Linux, multiple producer-consumer system using shared memory and a virtual round-robin CPU scheduler using threads.â€¢ Modified PintOS to run user programs with arguments and system calls."},{"title":"KGP RISC","start_date":"Sep 2019","end_date":"Nov 2019","description":"â€¢ Designed a 32-bit 5 stage pipelined CPU with MIPS-based ISA on verilog and configured on FPGA for hardware implementation."},{"title":"TinyC Compiler","start_date":"Aug 2019","end_date":"Nov 2019","description":"â€¢ Developed an assembly-code generating compiler for TinyC, a stripped-down version of the C language.â€¢ Implemented a lexical analyser using flex, a semantic parser & TAC generator using bison and created an x86 assembly code generator."},{}]
